types.name: ApiVersion
types.description:
A version of the API, as defined by [Shopify API versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).
Versions are commonly referred to by their handle (for example, `2021-10`).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is actively supported by Shopify. Supported API versions are guaranteed to be stable. Unsupported API versions include unstable, release candidate, and end-of-life versions that are marked as unsupported. For more information, refer to [Versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date and time string.
For example, 3:50 pm on September 7, 2019 in the time zone of UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) is
represented as `"2019-09-07T15:50:00Z`".

types.name: DisplayableError
types.description: Represents an error in the input of a mutation.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The path to the input field that caused the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: ID
types.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.

Example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`

types.name: MutationRoot
types.description: The schema's entry point for all mutation operations.

fields.name: captureSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open capture session.

After the `captureSessionReject` mutation completes on a given capture session, any
`captureSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `captureSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `reason` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: captureSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open capture session.

After the `captureSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given capture session, any
`captureSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `captureSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed.

fields.name: paymentSessionConfirm
fields.description:
Initiates the confirmation process of the given payment_session.

Shopify will start confirming the payment. According to its business logic, Shopify determines if the
payment can be authorized and sends a POST request to the payments app, delivering the confirmation result.

fields.name: paymentSessionPending
fields.description:
Change a payment session status to pending.

Upon receiving the response from the `PaymentSessionPending` mutation,
you must redirect the customer back to Shopify, using `redirectUrl` in `nextAction`.

Upon completion, pending payments must be finalized into either a successful or failed state using
the `paymentSessionResolve` or `paymentSessionReject` mutations.
Both `sale` and `authorization` payments can be marked as pending.

args.name: pendingExpiresAt
args.description: The date and time when the pending payment expires, recommended to be within 3 days.

args.name: reason
args.description: The reason the payment is pending.

fields.name: paymentSessionRedirect
fields.description:
Redirects the buyer to the given URL for the payment session.
For example, Shopify will redirect the buyer to the URL where the 3DS authentication will take place
for onsite payment with `credit_card` payment method.

args.name: redirectUrl
args.description: The URL that Shopify will redirect the buyer to, for 3DS authentication. Applicable to payments with the credit card payment method only.

fields.name: paymentSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open payment session.
After the `paymentSessionReject` mutation completes on a given payment session, any
`paymentSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `paymentSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

args.name: authentication
args.description: The 3D Secure authentication data from the partner. Must be present if and only if the Redirect mutation has been called and the payment method is credit card.

fields.name: paymentSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open payment session.
After the `paymentSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given payment session, any
`paymentSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `paymentSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

args.name: authorizationExpiresAt
args.description: The date and time when an authorized payment session expires.

args.name: authentication
args.description: The 3D Secure authentication data from the partner. Must be present if and only if the Redirect mutation has been called and the payment method is credit card.

args.name: networkTransactionId
args.description: The transaction ID issued by the network when processing the payment.

fields.name: paymentsAppConfigure
fields.description: Configures the partner-managed payments gateway to work on the merchant's store. For an example of how to use the `paymentsAppConfigure` mutation, refer to the [Onboard a merchant payments app](https://shopify.dev/apps/payments/getting-started/onboard-a-merchant-payments-apps) tutorial.

args.name: externalHandle
args.description: Handle used in the external system.

args.name: ready
args.description: The provider is ready to process merchant's payments.

fields.name: refundSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open refund session.
After the `refundSessionReject` mutation completes on a given refund session, any
`refundSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `refundSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: refundSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open refund session.
After the `refundSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given refund session, any
`refundSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `refundSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: voidSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open void session.
After the `voidSessionReject` mutation completes on a given void session, any
`voidSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `voidSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: voidSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open void session.
After the `voidSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given void session, any
`voidSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `voidSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_PAYMENT_METHOD

types.name: PaymentSessionStateRejectedReason
types.description: The possible values that can be used to describe the reasons why a payment is rejected.

enumValues.name: RISKY
enumValues.description: Rejected by risk control.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: Payment processing failure.

enumValues.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
enumValues.description: Credit card only. 3DS authentication failed. This Reason should be only used when the payments app does not want to proceed and confirm the payment after the 3DS authentication step.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_NUMBER
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided card number is valid but couldn't be processed.

enumValues.name: INVALID_NUMBER
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided card number does not match the expected format.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_CVC
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided CVC is valid but does not match the card's provider record.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CVC
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided CVC does not match the expected format.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ZIP
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided ZIP is valid but does not match the card's provider record.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided address is valid but does not match the card's provider record.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_PIN
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The provided PIN is valid but does not match the card's provider record.

enumValues.name: INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE
enumValues.description: Credit card only. The expiry date does not match the date format.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED_CARD
enumValues.description: Credit card only. Credit card expired.

enumValues.name: CARD_DECLINED
enumValues.description: Credit card only. Credit card declined.

enumValues.name: CONFIRMATION_REJECTED
enumValues.description: The payments app called the 'Confirm' mutation and Shopify rejected the confirmation.

types.name: PaymentSessionStateResolved
types.description: Additional details about a payment's resolved state.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The payment state code.

types.name: PaymentSessionStates
types.description: The possible values that can be used to describe the state of a payment transaction.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureAuthentication
types.description: The 3D Secure authentication data from the partner. One and only one of authentication_data and partner_error must be present.

inputFields.name: authenticationData
inputFields.description: The 3D Secure authentication data from the partner.

inputFields.name: partnerError
inputFields.description: The error that occurred in the partner environment while requesting the 3D Secure authentication or processing its result. Cannot be present if authentication_data is present.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureAuthenticationData
types.description: The input fields for the 3D Secure authentication data from the partner.

inputFields.name: transStatusReason
inputFields.description: The Transaction Status Reason, as documented by the EMVCo 2.x specification. Must match the "A(0[1-9]|1[0-9]|2[0-6]|[89][0-9])z" regular expression. Provides information on why the trans_status field has the specified value. Required if trans_status is one of [N, U, R].

inputFields.name: chargebackLiability
inputFields.description: Indicates if the liability for chargebacks has shifted away from the merchant.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureAuthenticationFlow
types.description: The 3D Secure Authentication Flow.

enumValues.name: FRICTIONLESS
enumValues.description: The Frictionless Flow does not require a Cardholder interaction.

enumValues.name: CHALLENGE
enumValues.description: The Challenge Flow does requires some Cardholder interaction.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Use this value for 3DS version 1 or when an error makes it impossible to establish what the flow is.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureChargebackLiability
types.description: Indicates if the liability for chargebacks has shifted away from the merchant.

enumValues.name: MERCHANT
enumValues.description: The merchant remains liable for chargebacks. This can be the case when a Strong Customer Authentication exemption is requested by the payments app on behalf of the merchant, for instance.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The merchant may not remain liable for chargebacks. This can be the case when no Strong Customer Authentication exemption is requested by the payments app on behalf of the merchant and when the authentication is successful, for instance. Cannot be used if trans_status is "N" or "R".

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecurePartnerError
types.description: The error that occurred in the partner environment while requesting the 3D Secure authentication or processing its result.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: Error while requesting the 3D Secure authentication or processing its result.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureTransStatus
types.description: Indicates whether a transaction qualifies as an authenticated transaction. For 3DS version 2, the EMV 3D Secure transaction status from the last of the Authentication Response (ARes) or Results Request (RReq) messages. For 3DS version 1, the 3D Secure PARes Status.

enumValues.name: Y
enumValues.description: Authentication Verification Successful.

enumValues.name: N
enumValues.description: Not Authenticated /Account Not Verified; Transaction denied.

enumValues.name: U
enumValues.description: Authentication/ Account Verification Could Not Be Performed; Technical or other problem.

enumValues.name: A
enumValues.description: Attempts Processing Performed; Not Authenticated/Verified, but a proof of attempted authentication/verification is provided.

enumValues.name: R
enumValues.description: Authentication/ Account Verification Rejected; Issuer is rejecting authentication/verification and request that authorisation not be attempted.

enumValues.name: I
enumValues.description: I = Informational Only; 3DS Requestor challenge preference acknowledged.

types.name: PaymentSessionThreeDSecureVersion
types.description: The 3D Secure version.

enumValues.name: V2_3
enumValues.description: Version 2.3.

enumValues.name: V2_2
enumValues.description: Version 2.2.

enumValues.name: V2_1
enumValues.description: Version 2.1.

enumValues.name: V1_0
enumValues.description: Version 1.0.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: Unknown version.

enumValues.description: Refund processing failure.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: URL
types.description:
Represents an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.

For example, `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"` is a valid URL. It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host
(`johns-apparel.myshopify.com`).

types.name: UserError
types.description: Represents an error in the input of a mutation.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The path to the input field that caused the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: VoidSession
types.description: A unique void transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique ID.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Details about the void state.

types.name: VoidSessionRejectPayload
types.description: Return type for `voidSessionReject` mutation.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.

fields.name: voidSession
fields.description: The updated void session.

types.name: VoidSessionRejectUserError
types.description: An error that occurs during the execution of `VoidSessionReject`.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The error code.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The path to the input field that caused the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: VoidSessionRejectUserErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `VoidSessionRejectUserError`.

enumValues.name: VOID_SESSION_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Void session not found.

enumValues.name: VOID_SESSION_INVALID_STATE
enumValues.description: Void session has already been resolved or has already been rejected with a different reason.

types.name: VoidSessionRejectionReasonInput
types.description: The input fields for the reason why the void transaction was rejected.

inputFields.name: merchantMessage
inputFields.description: A custom, localized message for the merchant.

types.name: VoidSessionResolvePayload
types.description: Return type for `voidSessionResolve` mutation.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: The list of errors that occurred from executing the mutation.

fields.name: voidSession
fields.description: The updated void session.

types.name: VoidSessionResolveUserError
types.description: An error that occurs during the execution of `VoidSessionResolve`.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The error code.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The path to the input field that caused the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: VoidSessionResolveUserErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `VoidSessionResolveUserError`.

enumValues.name: VOID_SESSION_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Void session not found.

enumValues.name: VOID_SESSION_INVALID_STATE
enumValues.description: Void session has already been rejected.

types.name: VoidSessionState
types.description: The state of a finalized void transaction.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The void state code.

types.name: VoidSessionStateCode
types.description: The possible values that can be used to describe the state of a finalized void transaction.

enumValues.name: RESOLVED
enumValues.description: Void resolved.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: Void rejected.

types.name: VoidSessionStateRejected
types.description: Additional details about a void's rejected state.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The void state code.

fields.name: merchantMessage
fields.description: The custom, localized message for the merchant.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason the void is rejected.

types.name: VoidSessionStateRejectedReason
types.description:
The possible values that can be used to describe
the reason why a void transaction is rejected.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: Void processing failure.

types.name: VoidSessionStateResolved
types.description: Additional details about a void's resolved state.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The void state code.

types.name: VoidSessionStates
types.description: The possible values that can be used to describe the state of a finalized void transaction.

types.name: VoidSessionStatusReasonRejectionCode
types.description: The possible values that can be used to describe the reason why a void transaction is rejected.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: Void processing failure.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.
